messages.message: I'm working with a client sample doc which is not rendering in AI Hub for some reason. @Subash, any idea what may be going on here?
I tried to remove it and upload again but facing the same issue
@Rakesh looks like a reader issue. Need to check if images are written properly
Image download paths are not properly parsed because of  `#`  in the file name, leading to this error
Ok, so we need to fix on frontend side ?

Yes, UI does not know how to parse `#` . Usually #es are used for hash based routing while building URLs. In this case, It parsed # as a routing param  while it is actually part of the file name. We have to look at alternatives for this one. Short fix will be to ensure that file name does not have a #

This isn't blocking in the short-term, but we need to fix this or at least display a better error message soon. It's a bad user experience to see this error. Could you please look into a fix here? Is there already a Jira ticket, or should I file a bug?
